title.en: A Brief Method for Reciting Samantabhadra's Prayer of Good Actions

text.en: In the Buddha, the Dharma and the Supreme Assembly
text.en-trans: sangye chö dang tsok kyi chok nam la

text.en: I take refuge until I attain enlightenment.
text.en-trans: changchub bardu dak ni kyab su chi

text.en: Through the merit of practising generosity and so on,
text.en-trans: dak gi jin sok gyipé sönam kyi

text.en: May I attain buddhahood for the benefit of all beings.
text.en-trans: dro la pen chir sangye drubpar shok

text.en: In the sky before me is the guru, the conqueror Śākyamuni,
text.en-trans: dün khar lama chomden shakya tub

text.en: And in front of him is the bodhisattva Samantabhadra,
In the cardinal and intermediate directions, above and below, are the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and the rest,
Who remain as witnesses to the fulfilment of these aspirations,
And declare facilitating words of truth, through which the objects of my aspiration
text.en-trans: tün gyur dentsik nangwé mönpé né

text.en: May be accomplished just as I wish for and request,
And so that having entirely perfected supreme enlightened action,
text.en-trans: changchub chö chok yongsu dzok gyur né

text.en: I may bring the aspirations of Samantabhadra to complete fulfilment.
Śākyamuni and his retinue melt into light and dissolve into me.
text.en-trans: tubwang khor ché ö zhu rang la tim

text.en: I rest in a state of clear light, free from conceptual elaboration.
text.en-trans: ösal tröpa dralwé ngang la zhak
